MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000465
Special Investigation Intake Date: March 12, 2025
License #: CB500316267
Licensee Group Organization: Family & Community Services Inc
Licensee Designee: Jennifer Vasilovski
Chief Administrator: Jennifer Vasilovski
Agency Name: FAMILY AND COMMUNITY SERVICES-
MACOMB
Agency Address: 42140 VAN DYKE AVE
STERLING HEIGHTS, MI 48314-3677
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 05/07/2027
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
5/21/2025 9:00 AM Phone Interview
5/14/2025 2:00 PM Phone Interview
3/17/2025 10:00 AM Phone Interview
3/12/2025 2:00 PM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans.
Section • (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
Description child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the
home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Initial Service Plan not completed timely.
1

Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 03/012/2025.
Foster Care Worker confirmed completing the initial service plan
for the time period 01/10/2025 to 02/06/2025 on 02/06/2025.
Foster Care Worker reported the family had submitted an
application for approval/inclusion with a recognized Native
American Tribe, but a determination had not yet been received
regarding the application. Foster Care Worker indicated she did
not have much experience dealing with tribal relations, but
information would be included in subsequent reports as it was
received.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 03/17/2025.
Chief Administrator confirmed completion of the Initial Service
Plan 02/06/2025 with final approval 02/18/2025, and it was
submitted to the court 03/12/2025.
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 05/14/2025.
Complainant did not have any additional information to report
related to this complaint/allegation.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the MISACWIS information for Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C. The case information documentation indicated the
agency assumed responsibility for this case 01/10/2025 the same
date the youth were removed from their home. An Initial Service
Plan was completed 02/06/2025, signed by the worker 02/06/2025
and the foster care supervisor 02/18/2025.
A Parent Agency Treatment Plan (PATP) dated 02/06/2025 for the
children's caregiver was signed by the worker 02/06/2025 and the
caregiver 03/10/2025. A PATP for the parents was signed by the
worker 02/06/2025 with a notation the parents refused to sign.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance per the interviews that were
completed and the documents that were reviewed. The date of
assumption for this case was 1/10/2025 and the 30-day time
period would require the Initial Service Plan to be completed by
02/09/2025 and it was completed 02/06/2025.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans.
Section • (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents
Description and the foster parents in the development of service plans
to enable the parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the parents' and the
foster parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying out
2

the plan. An agency shall give a copy to and review the
parent-agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the parent or
parents and foster parent that the information in the parent-
agency treatment plan and any other information about the
child and the child's family is confidential.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Parents were not involved in reviewing the Parent Agency
Treatment Plan -PATP.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 03/12/2025.
Foster Care Worker stated Foster Care Worker met with Father
and Mother of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C on 03/11/2025.
Foster Care Worker stated the family had submitted a tribal
application but had not yet received a response. Foster Care
Worker reported that the parents were involved, but disagreed
with the PATP and would not sign the PATP.
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 05/14/2025.
Complainant did not have any additional/different information to
report regarding the complaint.
I interviewed Mother by phone on 5/21/2025. Mother stated they
did review the PATP and confirmed it was received via email.
Mother stated they were not willing to sign the PATP because they
disagreed with it, even though the document includes a box that
can be checked to indicate disagreement and still be signed.
Mother confirmed participating in an FTM 2/06/2025 that included
both parents and the relative caregiver. Mother reported the most
recent FTM was 5/07/2025 with participants including Foster Care
Worker, both parents, relative caregiver, the original state worker,
ICWA worker, and the parent’s attorney.
Documents Reviewed:
The PATP dated 02/06/2025 for the parents of Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C included a notation that indicated the plan was
reviewed with the parents, but the parents refused to sign.
Documentation indicated a Family Team Meeting (FTM) was
completed 02/06/2025. Participants in the FTM were Father,
Mother, caregiver, and Foster Care Worker but the attendance
sheet was not signed.
3

A review of the initial and updated service plans documented
social work contacts occurring on 1/22/25, 1/23/25, 1/29/2025,
2/5/25, 2/7/2025, 3/11/25, and 3/25/2025 where issues relative to
expectations included in the PATP’s were presented/discussed
between Foster Care Worker and parent.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule. Documentation
reviewed included the completion of an FTM on 02/06/2025 with
the parents as well as a PATP that indicated the PATP was
reviewed with the parents with the notation the parents refused to
sign the PATP. Social work contacts that were reviewed reflected
additional discussions with the parents regarding issues
associated with the expectations/needs of the parents that were
identified in the PATP. Mother also reported in a phone interview
that the parents participated in an FTM on 05/07/2025.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
05/19/2025
______________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 22, 2025
